actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs

official_title: A concurrent resolution urging the President of the United States and the Governor of Guam to appoint representatives to discuss Federal-Territorial relations and to review the applicability of certain Federal laws and their impact on the Territory of Guam.

summary.text: Declares that it is the sense of Congress that the President and the Governor of Guam should appoint representatives to discuss future Federal-territorial relations and to review existing Federal laws and their impact on the political, social and economic well-being of Guam. Requires that such representatives submit annual reports to Congress containing any recommendations emerging from such discussions.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution urging the President of the United States and the Governor of Guam to appoint representatives to discuss Federal-Territorial relations and to review the applicability of certain Federal laws and their impact on the Territory of Guam.
